column7: We have management actions for all sites identified as potentially impacting protected biodiversity values. We continue to manage biodiversity offset sites at Coolumburra, NSW, and Narangba and Ormeau, Queensland.

The 960-hectare offset site at Coolumburra supports five native vegetation community types that provide a habitat for two threatened species, the koala and the large-eared pied bat (LEPB). Registering the land as a Stewardship Site will generate more than 3,600 ecosystem credits, which recognise the value of the vegetation and the habitat present on the land, combined with more than 7,000 species credits recognising the presence of koalas and LEPBs. Most of the credits generated will go towards meeting BoralÃ¢ÂÂs biodiversity offset obligations for new and progressive works at the Peppertree Quarry and the Marulan South Limestone Mine.
